panels.description: Nodegraph of all currently active hosts and their communication between each other

targets.queryText: SELECT * FROM nodes
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT * FROM nodes

targets.queryText: SELECT * From edges
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT * From edges

panels.title: Interhost traffic

targets.queryText: SELECT * FROM logs
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT * FROM logs

panels.description: Shows the process severity of the 5 most severe processes

targets.queryText:
SELECT uname, state_severity AS "State Severity", state_severity_level AS "State Severity Level" FROM current_processes
ORDER BY state_severity DESC, state_severity_level DESC
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT uname, state_severity AS "State Severity", state_severity_level AS "State Severity Level" FROM current_processes
ORDER BY state_severity DESC, state_severity_level DESC

panels.title: System Health Monitor

panels.description: Show the 5 publisher/subscribers receiving the most message drops.

targets.queryText:
SELECT hname, tname, direction, message_drops from current_topics
ORDER BY message_drops
Limit 5
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT hname, tname, direction, message_drops from current_topics
ORDER BY message_drops
Limit 5

panels.title: Message Drops

panels.description: Show the 50 processes with the highest network usage

targets.queryText:
SELECT tname, direction, SUM(CAST(tsize AS REAL) * dfreq  / 1000.0 ) as bandwidth
FROM current_topics
GROUP BY pid, direction
ORDER BY bandwidth DESC, tname DESC;
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT tname, direction, SUM(CAST(tsize AS REAL) * dfreq  / 1000.0 ) as bandwidth
FROM current_topics
GROUP BY pid, direction
ORDER BY bandwidth DESC, tname DESC;

panels.title: Bandwidth heatmap

panels.description: Show the five processes with the highest maximum latency recently

targets.queryText:
SELECT uname, latency_min AS "Min latency", latency_avg AS "Avg latency", latency_max AS "Max latency"  
FROM current_topics
GROUP BY pid
ORDER BY latency_max DESC
LIMIT 5
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT uname, latency_min AS "Min latency", latency_avg AS "Avg latency", latency_max AS "Max latency"  
FROM current_topics
GROUP BY pid
ORDER BY latency_max DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Latency view

panels.description: For each host show the percentage of used disk space.

targets.queryText:
SELECT 
  hname, 
  (capacity_disk - available_disk) * 100.0 / capacity_disk AS disk_usage_percent
FROM 
  hosts
WHERE 
  hname = 'P14SONB058'  
ORDER BY 
  time_stamp DESC 
LIMIT 1
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT 
  hname, 
  (capacity_disk - available_disk) * 100.0 / capacity_disk AS disk_usage_percent
FROM 
  hosts
WHERE 
  hname = '${hname}'  
ORDER BY 
  time_stamp DESC 
LIMIT 1

panels.title: Disk Usage $hname

panels.description: For each host show how much CPU is used (new monitoring param needed)

targets.queryText:
SELECT hname, cpu_load
FROM hosts
WHERE hname = 'P14SONB058' 
AND time_stamp = (SELECT MAX(time_stamp) FROM hosts WHERE hname = 'P14SONB058')
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT hname, cpu_load
FROM hosts
WHERE hname = '$hname' 
AND time_stamp = (SELECT MAX(time_stamp) FROM hosts WHERE hname = '$hname')

panels.title: CPU Usage $hname

panels.description: For each host show the percentage of used memory.

targets.queryText:
SELECT 
  hname, (total_memory - available_memory) * 100.0 / total_memory AS memory_used
FROM 
  hosts
WHERE 
  hname = 'P14SONB058' 
ORDER BY 
  time_stamp DESC 
LIMIT 1
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT 
  hname, (total_memory - available_memory) * 100.0 / total_memory AS memory_used
FROM 
  hosts
WHERE 
  hname = '$hname' 
ORDER BY 
  time_stamp DESC 
LIMIT 1

panels.title: RAM Usage $hname

targets.queryText: SELECT * FROM current_processes
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT * FROM current_processes

targets.queryText:
SELECT * 
FROM topics 
WHERE time_stamp = (SELECT MAX(time_stamp) FROM topics);
--- Select * from current_topics
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT * 
FROM topics 
WHERE time_stamp = (SELECT MAX(time_stamp) FROM topics);
--- Select * from current_topics

panels.description: Show the Publishers/Subscribers that have non-zero message_drops.

targets.queryText:
SELECT hname, pid, pname, uname, direction, tname from current_topics
WHERE message_drops != 0
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT hname, pid, pname, uname, direction, tname from current_topics
WHERE message_drops != 0

panels.title: Message Drops

panels.description: other viz for dropped processes see below

targets.queryText: SELECT * FROM dropped_processes
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT * FROM dropped_processes

panels.title: Dropped Processes

panels.description: List publishers that don't have a subscriber connected, either on the same host or on an external host.

targets.queryText:
SELECT hname, pid, pname, uname, direction, tname from current_topics
WHERE connections_ext = 0 AND connections_loc=0 AND direction = 'publisher'
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT hname, pid, pname, uname, direction, tname from current_topics
WHERE connections_ext = 0 AND connections_loc=0 AND direction = 'publisher'

panels.title: Publisher without Subscriber

panels.description: List subscribers that don't have an connection according to connections_loc and connections_ext. Seems odd, that the tsize != 0, another idea would be using directly tsize -> talk to Conti.

targets.queryText:
SELECT hname, tsize, pid, pname, uname, direction, tname from current_topics
WHERE connections_ext = 0 AND connections_loc=0 AND direction = 'subscriber'
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT hname, tsize, pid, pname, uname, direction, tname from current_topics
WHERE connections_ext = 0 AND connections_loc=0 AND direction = 'subscriber'

panels.title: Subscriber not receiving data

panels.description: Monitors total write throughout by the system's publishers in Bit/s (or Bytes/s, whatever tsize of STopicMon returns).

targets.queryText:
SELECT time_stamp, SUM(throughput) 
FROM topics 
WHERE direction = 'publisher' 
GROUP BY time_stamp;
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT time_stamp, SUM(throughput) 
FROM topics 
WHERE direction = 'publisher' 
GROUP BY time_stamp;

panels.title: Global Published Data

panels.description: Monitors total read throughout by the system's subscribers in Bit/s (or Bytes/s, whatever tsize of STopicMon returns).

targets.queryText:
SELECT time_stamp, SUM(throughput) 
FROM topics 
WHERE direction = 'subscriber' 
GROUP BY time_stamp;
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT time_stamp, SUM(throughput) 
FROM topics 
WHERE direction = 'subscriber' 
GROUP BY time_stamp;

panels.description: A list with names and timestamps when a process is shutdown irrespective whether it was graceful or not

targets.queryText:
SELECT uname, time(time_stamp) FROM dropped_processes
ORDER BY time(time_stamp) DESC
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT uname, time(time_stamp) FROM dropped_processes
ORDER BY time(time_stamp) DESC

panels.title: Dropped processes

panels.description: Monitors total traffic throughout the whole system in Bit/s (or Bytes/s, whatever tsize of STopicMon returns) , irrespective of transportation type.

targets.queryText:
SELECT time_stamp, sum(datawrite) FROM processes
GROUP BY time_stamp
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT time_stamp, sum(datawrite) FROM processes
GROUP BY time_stamp

panels.title: Global Data Write
